clinical_study.brief_title: Concurrent Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation and Gait Training in Parkinson's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Concurrent Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation and Gait Training on Gait Performance When Doing the Cognitive Dual-task in People With Parkinson's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the effect of concurrent transcranial direct current stimulation and gait training on gait performance when doing the cognitive dual-task in people with Parkinson's Disease.

primary_outcome.description: To evaluate gait parameters while doing dual-task walking

secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate gait parameters while doing single walking

secondary_outcome.measure: Stroop color and word test-Chinese version

arm_group.arm_group_label: Active tDCS plus gait training group
arm_group.description: Participants in Active tDCS plus gait training group will execute Active tDCS on left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex which combined with treadmill, 12 times per week, least 4 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Sham tDCS plus gait training group
arm_group.description: Participants in Sham tDCS plus gait training group will executeSham tDCS on left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex which combined with treadmill, 12 times per week, least 4 weeks.

intervention.description: Participants in experimental group will accept Active tDCS which combined with treadmill
intervention.arm_group_label: Active tDCS plus gait training group

intervention.description: Participants in control group will accept Sham tDCS which combined with treadmill
intervention.arm_group_label: Sham tDCS plus gait training group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with idiopathic PD
- Hoehn and Yahr stages I-III
- Mini Mental Status Examination (MMSE) score â‰§ 24
- Could walk 10m independently with or without gait aid
Exclusion Criteria:
- Concurrent medication likely to affect mental performance
- tDCS contraindication
- Significant neurological, vestibular, visual disorders or psychiatric illness
- Musculoskeletal or cardiopulmonary disease
- Sensory system pathology
